description: [Premium Times] The role of higher education encompasses a wide range of responsibilities and has a broad impact.
title: Africa: Higher Education and the Transformation of Africa, By Toyin Falola

description: [The Herald] Mukudzei Chingwere in TEHRAN, Iran
title: Africa: Iran-Africa Conference an Eye Opener - VP Chiwenga

description: [The Herald] Zimbabwe will host the first of its kind United Nations Africa Gastronomy Forum this year, as the country continues to demonstrate that it is a formidable force in terms of hosting key regional and global events.
title: Africa: Nation to Host World's First UN Africa Gastronomy Forum

description: [ISS] Africa can't afford to continue being absent from the UN's pivotal shake-up of global governance.
title: Africa: Time Running Out for Africa's Input On the Summit of the Future

description: [UNHCR] Doha -- UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, and global development organization Education Above All (EAA) Foundation have signed a new, five-year agreement aimed at addressing the global challenge of out-of-school children (OOSC), including refugees, internally displaced people and host community children. The new agreement builds on the success of enrolling more than 1.6 million OOSC in 14 countries globally since 2012.
title: Africa: Education Above All Foundation and UNHCR Partner to Enrol More Out-of-School, Refugee Children

description: [Accra Time] With a joint EP on the way, Prince Bright and Stonebwoy give us a sneak peek of what to expect; enter 'Back To Sender (Taamiawu).' This electrifying mid-tempo Afrobeats anthem is guaranteed to keep bad energy at bay, making it the perfect daily companion.
title: Africa: Prince Bright and Stonebwoy Share New Afrobeats Anthem 'Back to Sender (Taamiawu)'

description: [UCT] On 23 April 2024, as part of a series of events to mark Green Week, the Green Campus Initiative (GCI) at the University of Cape Town (UCT) participated in a Climate Change and Health Seminar on the campus of the Faculty of Health Sciences (FHS). The seminar was hosted by James Irlam, a senior lecturer in the Primary Health Care Directorate.
title: Africa: 'The Climate Crisis Is a Public Health Crisis'

description: [The Conversation Africa] The Earth now supports over eight billion people who collectively have transformed three-quarters of the planet's land surface for food, energy, shelter and other aspects of the human enterprise.
title: Africa: The Covid-19 Pandemic Changed Our Patterns and Behaviours, Which in Turn Affected Wildlife
